body:
> The Plan 9 file systems are usually slow,

Can we use a memory filesystem instead? We can use any GCE instance type, including ones with tons of memory. Maybe that doesn't help on a 32-bit plan9.  But 2GB of memory should be fine even, no?

> but this is amplified in virtual environments.

Not sure why (no virtio?), but okay.

I downloaded drawterm from the swtch.com site and ran ./drawterm-osx-intel -a $IP -c $IP -u glenda with the glenda123 password.

Anyway, I'm still confused why it works fine when I run the tests by hand, but fails for being too slow under the buildlet.
